name: Radio Resource Partitioning
summary: This feature enables the configuration of predefined shares of radio resources in a

parameters.name: QciProfilePredefined.serviceType
parameters.description: When this parameter is set to IMS_SIGNALING or                                     MC_SIGNALING and value of                                     ResourcePartitions.gbrPartitioning parameter                                 is set to false, all bearers with QCI keep their                                 priority.

parameters.name: QciProfileOperatorDefined.serviceType
parameters.description: When this parameter is set to IMS_SIGNALING or                                     MC_SIGNALING and value of                                     ResourcePartitions.gbrPartitioning parameter                                 is set to false, all bearers with QCI keep their                                 priority.

parameters.name: INTERNAL_PER_PARTITION_REPORT
parameters.type: EVENT_PARAM_PARTITION_ID  EVENT_PARAM_MEASUREMENT_PERIOD  EVENT_PARAM_PARTITION_PRB_DL_MAX  EVENT_PARAM_PARTITION_PRB_DL_MIN  EVENT_PARAM_PARTITION_PRB_DL_SUM  EVENT_PARAM_PARTITION_PRB_UL_MAX  EVENT_PARAM_PARTITION_PRB_UL_MIN  EVENT_PARAM_PARTITION_PRB_UL_SUM  EVENT_PARAM_AVAIL_PRB_UL_RESOURCES  EVENT_PARAM_AVAIL_PRB_DL_RESOURCES  EVENT_PARAM_PRB_UL_UTILIZATION  EVENT_PARAM_PRB_DL_UTILIZATION  EVENT_PARAM_GBR_UL_UTILIZATION  EVENT_PARAM_GBR_DL_UTILIZATION
parameters.description: This event reports the use for each resource type for a given                                     partition. This event results in PM counter pegging.

parameters.name: INTERNAL_PER_UETR_PARTITION_REPORT
parameters.type: EVENT_PARAM_PARTITION_ID  EVENT_PARAM_MEASUREMENT_PERIOD  EVENT_PARAM_PARTITION_PRB_DL_MAX  EVENT_PARAM_PARTITION_PRB_DL_MIN  EVENT_PARAM_PARTITION_PRB_DL_SUM  EVENT_PARAM_PARTITION_PRB_UL_MAX  EVENT_PARAM_PARTITION_PRB_UL_MIN  EVENT_PARAM_PARTITION_PRB_UL_SUM  EVENT_PARAM_AVAIL_PRB_UL_RESOURCES  EVENT_PARAM_AVAIL_PRB_DL_RESOURCES  EVENT_PARAM_PRB_UL_UTILIZATION  EVENT_PARAM_PRB_DL_UTILIZATION  EVENT_PARAM_GBR_UL_UTILIZATION   EVENT_PARAM_GBR_DL_UTILIZATION
parameters.description: This event reports the use for each resource type for a given                                     partition.

parameters.name: INTERNAL_EVENT_PARTITION_CONFIG_MISSING
parameters.description: This event alerts a potential misconfiguration of resource                                     partition configuration. The event uses a bitmap to specify                                     configuration problems. The event is sent when there are fewer                                     than two resource partitions defined in the cell at cell unlock.                                     An event is sent if a PLMN exists in the shared RAN additional                                     PLMN list, but does not appear in any partition currently                                     configured in the cell. This applies to cell unlock and the                                     addition of a new PLMN to the additional PLMN list.

events.description: This event reports the use for each resource type for a given                                     partition. This event results in PM counter pegging.

events.name: INTERNAL_EVENT_PARTITION_CONFIG_MISSING
events.description: This event alerts a potential misconfiguration of resource                                     partition configuration. The event uses a bitmap to specify                                     configuration problems. The event is sent when there are fewer                                     than two resource partitions defined in the cell at cell unlock.                                     An event is sent if a PLMN exists in the shared RAN additional                                     PLMN list, but does not appear in any partition currently                                     configured in the cell. This applies to cell unlock and the                                     addition of a new PLMN to the additional PLMN list.

activation_step: 1. Set the FeatureState.featureState attribute to ACTIVATED in the FeatureState=CXC4012019 MO instance.
deactivation_step: 1. Set the FeatureState.featureState attribute to DEACTIVATED in the FeatureState=CXC4012019 MO instance.
